thread.title: Solange Knowles deletes Grammy tweets after Beyoncé’s snubs - NY Daily News
thread.title_full: Solange Knowles deletes Grammy tweets after Beyoncé’s snubs - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Solange Knowles deletes Grammy tweets after Beyoncé’s snubs - NY Daily News
text:
Solange Knowles defended her sister after the Grammys, then deleted the evidence.
After Beyoncé lost out on Song, Record and Album of the Year to Adele, Knowles tweeted a link to Frank Ocean’s Tumblr post that accused the Grammys of “cultural bias” when Taylor Swift beat Kendrick Lamar for Album of the Year in 2014.
“Waddup Frank,” she wrote Sunday night.
On Monday, she followed up.
Grammys 2017 winners and losers 
“Create your own committees, build your own institutions,” she tweeted mid-afternoon, "give your friends awards, award yourself, and be the gold you wanna gold my g’s."
“There have only been two black winners in the last 20 years for album of the year there have been over 200 black artist who have performed,” the younger Knowles sister said in a now-deleted message.
Despite being nominated for a leading nine Grammy Awards, Beyoncé walked away with just two: Best Music Video for “Formation” and Best Urban Contemporary Album for “Lemonade.” (Christopher Polk/Getty Images for NARAS) But by 6 p.m. Monday, all of Knowles’ Grammy tweets had been erased.
Her reps did not return a request for comment on the deleted posts.
Adele wins but admits Beyoncé should have received Grammy 
Adele, who swept the top three awards Sunday night, made similar remarks, albeit less subtle.
Adele, who swept the top three awards Sunday night, taking home Song, Record and Album of the Year. (LUCY NICHOLSON/REUTERS) “I can't possibly accept this award, and I'm very humbled, and I'm very grateful and gracious but, my artist of my life is Beyoncé,” the “Hello” singer said while accepting Album of the Year for “25.”
“And this album for me, the 'Lemonade' album, is so monumental, and so well thought out, and so beautiful.”
Despite being nominated for a leading nine Grammy Awards, Beyoncé walked away with just two: Best Music Video for “Formation” and Best Urban Contemporary Album for “Lemonade.”
Beyoncé and the top moments from the 2017 Grammy Awards
